intro: Houlletia antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian houlletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Houlletia antioquensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
